text: Christopher Joseph Gedney (August 9, 1970 â€“ March 9, 2018) was an American college and professional football player. He was born in Liverpool, New York. He was a tight end in the National Football League (NFL) for six seasons. He played professionally for the Chicago Bears and Arizona Cardinals of the NFL. Gedney died on March 9, 2018 in Syracuse, New York, age 47.Stephen Bailey, Former Syracuse football star Chris Gedney dies at age 47, Syracuse.com, March 9, 2018, accessed March 9, 2018. After his death, an autopsy revealed that Gedney had been suffering from Stage 2 chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE). ==References== Category:1970 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Arizona Cardinals players Category:Chicago Bears players Category:Sportspeople from New York (state) Category:Sportspeople from Syracuse, New York Category:American football tight ends Category:Deaths from chronic traumatic encephalopathy
title: Chris Gedney
